thread.title: Galion tops Harding with field goal
thread.title_full: Galion tops Harding with field goal

title: Galion tops Harding with field goal
text:
Galion tops Harding with field goal Anthony Conchel , Editor 11:04 p.m. EDT October 2, 2015 Buy Photo Marion Harding's Titus Douglas drives the ball downfield during the Marion Harding Vs Galion on Friday night. (Photo: Matthew Hatcher, Matthew Hatcher/ The Marion Star) Buy Photo 5 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
MARION â€” Galion and Harding may have just found the perfect new rivalry. 
Both teams came into Friday night's Mid Ohio Athletic Conference tussle with 2-3 records overall, with the Presidents riding a 2-game win streak. 
"This was a great ball game, and we needed it," Galion coach Chris Hawkins said after his team edged Harding 24-21 on a cold, wet night. 
Both teams found pay dirt early, with the visitors striking first. 
Drake Barnett went up the middle for 14 yards to put Galion on top 6-0. Harding struck back quickly, however. 
Titus Douglas ran in from 19 yards and the extra point kick from Savion Tyler put Harding ahead 7-6 after one quarter. 
A sluggish second quarter changed abruptly. 
Harding quarterback Ryan Sayre hit T.J. Jefferson with a bubble screen pass and the 135-pound wideout did the rest, going 61 yards for the tying score.Tyler's kick gave Harding a 14-13 halftime lead. 
Hawkins said his team had chances last week but took better advantage of opportunities this week. 
"After that fourth-and-eight reception, I thought, 'Come on, defense.' They stepped it up." 
The second half featured several big plays. 
Jacob Fryer rambled 36 yards for a Galion score giving his club a 19-14 lead with 6:43 to go in the third period. 
But the Presidents answered. 
Harding moved the ball through the air and on the ground, with Keyan Herrell going in from the 2-yard-line. That knotted the score at 21. 
"I thought after we got that fumble recovery, that we were going to take it down and score, but penalties killed us," Hawkins said. 
Galion was flagged seven times for 75 yards in penalties to Harding's four for 30 yards. 
The game was ultimately decided off the foot of Galion's Conner Moreton, who nailed a 35-yard field goal with 7:15 to play in the game. 
Harding didn't quit, even after Ryan Talbott's fumble recovery of a mishandled ball. 
Sayre drove his team with passes of 15 and 16 yards to Jefferson, but the Presidents' second lost fumble of the game ended it with 2:08 to play. 
On the night he completed 10-of-12 passes for 142 yards. Douglas ran the ball 16 times for 102 yards; Jefferson had four catches for 97 yards. 
Chase Cooke connected on 6 of 12 passes for 64 yards for the Tigers. 
Workhouse Barnett carried the ball 32 times for 161 yards, with Fryer adding 96 yards on 10 carries. 
Hawkins credited Harding with improvement despite the tough loss. 
"Marion has come a long way and are headed in the right direction. They have some athletes," Hawkins said. 
"I'm very proud of our defense because they haven't stepped it up to seal a game the last two times, so it was so nice to see that tonight." 
aconchel@gannett.com
